com.github.methylene.sym

Class PermutationFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.methylene.sym.PermutationFactory

  • public final class PermutationFactory
extends Object

    This class contains the sort and from factory methods.

    sort delegates to java.util.Arrays.sort, however it doesn't actually sort the input but only returns a permutation that will sort the input when applied to it.

    The from factory method allows permutation definition "by example".

      static class  PermutationFactory.Builder
      A builder that can be used to create instances of PermutationFactory.

      • sort

        public Permutation sort(char[] input)
        Returns a permutation that sorts the input array. There is no guarantee which permutation will be chosen if there is a choice, i.e. if the input contains duplicates.
        Parameters:
        input - an array, not necessarily distinct
        Returns:
        a permutation that sorts the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if strict is true and input contains duplicates

      • sort

        Returns a permutation that sorts the input.
        See Also:
        sort(char[])

               Comparator comp)

      • sort

        public Permutation sort(int[] input)
        Returns a permutation that sorts the input array. There is no guarantee which one will be chosen if there is a choice, i.e. if the input contains duplicates.
        Parameters:
        input - an array of integers
        Returns:
        a permutation that sorts the input
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if strict is true and input contains duplicates

      • sort

        public Permutation sort(String s)
        Returns a permutation that sorts the input string.
        Parameters:
        s - a string
        Returns:
        a permutation that sorts s

      • from

        public Permutation from(int[] a,
               int[] b)
        Returns a permutation that rearranges a into b.
        Parameters:
        a - an array
        b - an array that can be obtained by changing the order of the elements of a
        Returns:
        a permutation so that Arrays.equals(Permutation.from(a, b).apply(a), b) is true
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if strict is true and a or b contain duplicates, or if b can not be obtained by rearranging a.

      • from

        public Permutation from(Comparable[] a,
               Comparable[] b)
        Returns a permutation that rearranges a into b. See the documentation of from(int[], int[]) for details.

      • from

        public Permutation from(Object[] a,
               Object[] b,
               Comparator comp)
        Returns a permutation that rearranges a into b. The comparator comp must be able to compare all elements in a and b It is needed for efficient lookups in b. See the documentation of from(int[], int[]) for details.
